name: G-stream G2020
summary:
G-Stream G2020 (later known as ΔZEAL and DELTAZEAL) is a 2D sci-fi vertical-scrolling shoot-'em-up developed and released by Oriental Soft Japan for arcades exclusively in Japan in 2002.
The game was known for its rocky history, as it is revealed by main programmer Toshiaki Fujino (a former programmer with KCE Japan) that the team contracted by Oriental Soft to develop the game was never paid (with the company going defunct shortly after the game's release).
Fujino went on to form the studio Triangle Service and as Fujino regained the rights to the game, G-Stream received some ports as ΔZEAL (or DELTAZEAL) a decade later (as part of the studio's ZEAL series). It was first ported by Triangle Service to the Xbox 360, bundled with a port of XIIZEAL as part of Triangle Service's Shooting Love. compilation series. Released by 5pb on May 30, 2013 exclusively in Japan as Shooting Love. 10-Shuunen: XIIZEAL & ΔZEAL, this compilation was later itself bundled with Shooting Love. 200X on December 19, 2013 as Shooting Love. Collection. The Xbox 360 version was later ported to the PC, with a digital worldwide release (via Steam) by Degica on October 16, 2015.
info:
• 中文名: G暴风战机-G2020
